dependencies.description:
Libxml2 is the XML C parser and toolkit developed for the Gnome project
(but usable outside of the Gnome platform), it is free software
available under the MIT License.
dependencies.name: libxml2

dependencies.description:
The ncurses (new curses) library is a free software emulation of curses
in System V Release 4.0, and more. It uses terminfo format, supports
pads and color and multiple highlights and forms characters and
function-key mapping, and has all the other SYSV-curses enhancements
over BSD curses.
dependencies.name: ncurses

dependent_to.description:
The 3D Toolkit provides algorithms and methods to process 3D point
clouds. It includes automatic high-accurate registration (6D
simultaneous localization and mapping, 6D SLAM) and other tools, e.g., a
fast 3D viewer, plane extraction software, etc. Several file formats for
the point clouds are natively supported, new formats can be implemented
easily.
dependent_to.name: 3dtk

dependent_to.description:
AccFFT extends existing FFT libraries for CUDA-enabled Graphics
Processing Units (GPUs) to distributed memory clusters
dependent_to.name: accfft

dependent_to.description:
A Common Tracking Software (Acts) This project contains an experiment-
independent set of track reconstruction tools. The main philosophy is to
provide high-level track reconstruction modules that can be used for any
tracking detector. The description of the tracking detector's geometry
is optimized for efficient navigation and quick extrapolation of tracks.
Converters for several common geometry description languages exist.
Having a highly performant, yet largely customizable implementation of
track reconstruction algorithms was a primary objective for the design
of this toolset. Additionally, the applicability to real-life HEP
experiments plays major role in the development process. Apart from
algorithmic code, this project also provides an event data model for the
description of track parameters and measurements. Key features of this
project include: tracking geometry description which can be constructed
from TGeo, DD4Hep, or GDML input, simple and efficient event data model,
performant and highly flexible algorithms for track propagation and
fitting, basic seed finding algorithms.
dependent_to.name: acts

dependent_to.description:
The Adaptable Input Output System version 2, developed in the Exascale
Computing Program
dependent_to.name: adios2

dependent_to.description: Simple applications for determining Linux thread and gpu affinity.
dependent_to.name: affinity

dependent_to.description: Abstraction Library for Parallel Kernel Acceleration.
dependent_to.name: alpaka

dependent_to.description:
Aluminum provides a generic interface to high-performance communication
libraries, with a focus on allreduce algorithms. Blocking and non-
blocking algorithms and GPU-aware algorithms are supported. Aluminum
also contains custom implementations of select algorithms to optimize
for certain situations.
dependent_to.name: aluminum

dependent_to.description:
Amber is a suite of biomolecular simulation programs together with Amber
tools. A manual download is required for Ambers. Spack will search your
current directory for the download files. Alternatively, add the files
to a mirror so that Spack can find them. For instructions on how to set
up a mirror, see https://spack.readthedocs.io/en/latest/mirrors.html
Note: Only certain versions of ambertools are compatible with amber.
Only the latter version of ambertools for each amber version is
supported.
dependent_to.name: amber

dependent_to.description:
AMG2023 is a parallel algebraic multigrid solver for linear systems
arising from problems on unstructured grids. The driver provided here
builds linear systems for various 3-dimensional problems. It requires an
installation of hypre-2.27.0 or higher.
dependent_to.name: amg2023

dependent_to.description:
AmgX provides a simple path to accelerated core solver technology on
NVIDIA GPUs. AmgX provides up to 10x acceleration to the computationally
intense linear solver portion of simulations, and is especially well
suited for implicit unstructured methods. It is a high performance,
state-of-the-art library and includes a flexible solver composition
system that allows a user to easily construct complex nested solvers and
preconditioners.
dependent_to.name: amgx

dependent_to.description:
AML is a memory management library designed to ease the use of complex
memory topologies and complex data layout optimizations for high-
performance computing applications.
dependent_to.name: aml

dependent_to.description:
AMR-Wind is a massively parallel, block-structured adaptive-mesh,
incompressible flow sover for wind turbine and wind farm simulations.
dependent_to.name: amr-wind

dependent_to.description:
AMReX is a publicly available software framework designed for building
massively parallel block- structured adaptive mesh refinement (AMR)
applications.
dependent_to.name: amrex

dependent_to.description: AMS Autonomous Multiscale Framework.
dependent_to.name: ams

dependent_to.description:
Apache TVM is an open source machine learning compiler framework for
CPUs, GPUs, and machine learning accelerators. It aims to enable machine
learning engineers to optimize and run computations efficiently on any
hardware backend.
dependent_to.name: apache-tvm

dependent_to.description: Autonomic Performance Environment for eXascale (APEX).
dependent_to.name: apex

dependent_to.description:
Arbor is a high-performance library for computational neuroscience
simulations.
dependent_to.name: arbor

dependent_to.description: ArborX is a performance-portable library for geometric search
dependent_to.name: arborx

dependent_to.description:
ArrayFire is a high performance software library for parallel computing
with an easy-to-use API. Its array based function set makes parallel
programming more accessible.
dependent_to.name: arrayfire

dependent_to.description:
A cross-language development platform for in-memory data. This package
contains the C++ bindings.
dependent_to.name: arrow

dependent_to.description:
Ascent is an open source many-core capable lightweight in situ
visualization and analysis infrastructure for multi-physics HPC
simulations.
dependent_to.name: ascent

dependent_to.description: autodiff is automatic differentiation made easier for C++.
dependent_to.name: autodiff

dependent_to.description:
AutoDock-GPU: AutoDock for GPUs and other accelerators. OpenCL and Cuda
accelerated version of AutoDock 4.2.6. It leverages its embarrasingly
parallelizable LGA by processing ligand-receptor poses in parallel over
multiple compute units.
dependent_to.name: autodock-gpu

dependent_to.description:
AWS OFI NCCL is a plug-in which enables EC2 developers to use libfabric
as a network provider while running NVIDIA's NCCL based applications.
dependent_to.name: aws-ofi-nccl

dependent_to.description:
Axom provides a robust, flexible software infrastructure for the
development of multi-physics applications and computational tools.
dependent_to.name: axom

dependent_to.description:
Measure memory transfer rates to/from global device memory on GPUs. This
benchmark is similar in spirit, and based on, the STREAM benchmark for
CPUs.
dependent_to.name: babelstream

dependent_to.description: BART: Toolbox for Computational Magnetic Resonance Imaging
dependent_to.name: bart

dependent_to.description:
Fluid interface model solver based on Pandya and Shkoller's Z-Model
formulation.
dependent_to.name: beatnik

dependent_to.description:
BigDFT-CheSS: A module for performing Fermi Operator Expansions via
Chebyshev Polynomials.
dependent_to.name: bigdft-chess

dependent_to.description:
BigDFT-core: the core components of BigDFT, an electronic structure
calculation based on Daubechies wavelets.
dependent_to.name: bigdft-core

dependent_to.description:
BigDFT-futile: a library handling most common FORTRAN low-level
operations, like memory managment, profiling routines, I/O operations.
It also supports yaml output and parsing for fortran programs. It also
provides wrappers routines to MPI and linear algebra operations. This
library is intensively used in BigDFT packages.
dependent_to.name: bigdft-futile

dependent_to.description: BigDFT-liborbs: a library for orbital treatments in DFT.
dependent_to.name: bigdft-liborbs

dependent_to.description:
BigDFT-Psolver: a flexible real-space Poisson Solver based on
Interpolating Scaling Functions. It constitutes a fundamental building
block of BigDFT code, and it can also be used separately and linked to
other codes.
dependent_to.name: bigdft-psolver

dependent_to.description:
C++ API for the Basic Linear Algebra Subroutines. Developed by the
Innovative Computing Laboratory at the University of Tennessee,
Knoxville.
dependent_to.name: blaspp

dependent_to.description:
The basic matrix library (bml) is an implementation of various matrix
data formats (dense and sparse) and their associated algorithms for
basic matrix operations used electronic structure solvers.
dependent_to.name: bml

dependent_to.description: Library for automatic acceleration of array operations
dependent_to.name: bohrium

dependent_to.description:
Bricks is a data layout and code generation framework, enabling
performance-portable stencil computations across a multitude of
architectures.
dependent_to.name: bricks

dependent_to.description: The Exascale Co-Design Center for Particle Applications Toolkit
dependent_to.name: cabana

dependent_to.description:
Caffe is a deep learning framework made with expression, speed, and
modularity in mind. It is developed by the Berkeley Vision and Learning
Center (BVLC) and by community contributors.
dependent_to.name: caffe

dependent_to.description:
Caliper is a program instrumentation and performance measurement
framework. It is designed as a performance analysis toolbox in a
library, allowing one to bake performance analysis capabilities directly
into applications and activate them at runtime.
dependent_to.name: caliper

dependent_to.description:
Compiler agnostic metaprogramming library providing concepts, type
operations and tuples for C++ and cuda
dependent_to.name: camp

dependent_to.description: Cardiac simulation suite.
dependent_to.name: cardioid

dependent_to.description: CHAI and RAJA extensions (includes data structures and algorithms).
dependent_to.name: care

dependent_to.description:
CBTF Argo Navis project contains the CUDA collector and supporting
libraries that was done as a result of a DOE SBIR grant.
dependent_to.name: cbtf-argonavis

dependent_to.description:
CBTF Argo Navis GUI project contains the GUI that views OpenSpeedShop
performance information by loading in the Sqlite database files.
dependent_to.name: cbtf-argonavis-gui

dependent_to.description:
Ceed is a collection of benchmarks, miniapps, software libraries and
APIs for efficient high-order finite element and spectral element
discretizations for exascale applications developed in the Department of
Energy (DOE) and partially supported by the Exascale Computing Project
(ECP). This is a Spack bundle package that installs the CEED software
components.
dependent_to.name: ceed

dependent_to.description:
Celeritas is a new Monte Carlo transport code designed for high-
performance (GPU-targeted) simulation of high-energy physics detectors.
dependent_to.name: celeritas

dependent_to.description: Copy-hiding array interface for data migration between memory spaces
dependent_to.name: chai

dependent_to.description: Dense Linear Algebra for Scalable Multi-core Architectures and GPGPUs
dependent_to.name: chameleon

dependent_to.description:
ChaNGa (Charm N-body GrAvity solver) is a code to perform collisionless
N-body simulations.
dependent_to.name: changa

dependent_to.description:
Chapel is a modern programming language that is parallel, productive,
portable, scalable and open-source. The Chapel package comes with many
options in the form of variants, most of which can be left unset to
allow Chapel's built-in scripts to determine the proper values based on
the environment.
dependent_to.name: chapel

dependent_to.description:
Charm++ is a parallel programming framework in C++ supported by an
adaptive runtime system, which enhances user productivity and allows
programs to run portably from small multicore computers (your laptop) to
the largest supercomputers.
dependent_to.name: charmpp

dependent_to.description:
CitcomS is a finite element code designed to solve compressible
thermochemical convection problems relevant to Earth's mantle.
dependent_to.name: citcoms

dependent_to.description:
Proxy Application. CloverLeaf is a miniapp that solves the compressible
Euler equations on a Cartesian grid, using an explicit, second-order
accurate method.
dependent_to.name: cloverleaf

dependent_to.description:
The Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit is a unified deep-learning toolkit that
describes neural networks as a series of computational steps via a
directed graph.
dependent_to.name: cntk

dependent_to.description: Distributed Communication-Optimal Matrix-Matrix Multiplication Library
dependent_to.name: cosma

dependent_to.description:
This is a an implementation of the CosmoFlow 3D convolutional neural
network for benchmarking. It is written in TensorFlow with the Keras API
and uses Horovod for distributed training.
dependent_to.name: cosmoflow-benchmark

dependent_to.description:
COUNTDOWN is a tool for identifying and automatically reducing the power
consumption of the computing elements, during communication and
synchronization primitives, filtering out phases which would detriment
the time to solution of the application.
dependent_to.name: countdown

dependent_to.description:
Covfie is a library for compositional descriptions of storage methods
for vector fields and other structured multi-dimensional data.
dependent_to.name: covfie

dependent_to.description:
CP2K is a quantum chemistry and solid state physics software package
that can perform atomistic simulations of solid state, liquid,
molecular, periodic, material, crystal, and biological systems
dependent_to.name: cp2k

dependent_to.description:
Cray's MPICH is a high performance and widely portable implementation of
the Message Passing Interface (MPI) standard.
dependent_to.name: cray-mpich

dependent_to.description:
Maintained and updated fork of cuda_memtest. original homepage:
http://sourceforge.net/projects/cudagpumemtest . This software tests GPU
memory for hardware errors and soft errors using CUDA or OpenCL.
dependent_to.name: cuda-memtest

dependent_to.description:
NVIDIA cuDNN is a GPU-accelerated library of primitives for deep neural
networks
dependent_to.name: cudnn

dependent_to.description:
NVIDIA cuDSS is a GPU-accelerated Direct Sparse Solver library for
solving linear systems with very sparse matrices
dependent_to.name: cudss

dependent_to.description: A GPU accelerated error-bounded lossy compression for scientific data
dependent_to.name: cusz

dependent_to.description:
NVIDIA cuTENSOR Library is a GPU-accelerated tensor linear algebra
library providing tensor contraction, reduction and elementwise
operations.
dependent_to.name: cutensor

dependent_to.description: CUDA Templates for Linear Algebra Subroutines
dependent_to.name: cutlass

dependent_to.description:
Data & Vis SDK ** This package is a post-ECP port from the ECP Data &
Vis SDK **
dependent_to.name: dav-sdk

dependent_to.description: Distributed Block Compressed Sparse Row matrix library.
dependent_to.name: dbcsr

dependent_to.description:
C++ software library providing well-documented tools to build finite
element codes for a broad variety of PDEs.
dependent_to.name: dealii

dependent_to.description: GPU-based dedispersion package.
dependent_to.name: dedisp

dependent_to.description:
DiHydrogen is the second version of the Hydrogen fork of the well-known
distributed linear algebra library, Elemental. DiHydrogen aims to be a
basic distributed multilinear algebra interface with a particular
emphasis on the needs of the distributed machine learning effort, LBANN.
dependent_to.name: dihydrogen

dependent_to.description: DLA-Future library: Distributed Linear Algebra with Future
dependent_to.name: dla-future

dependent_to.description:
toolkit containing machine learning algorithms and tools for creating
complex software in C++ to solve real world problems
dependent_to.name: dlib

dependent_to.description:
Dorado is a high-performance, easy-to-use, open source basecaller for
Oxford Nanopore reads.
dependent_to.name: dorado

dependent_to.description:
Draco is an object-oriented component library geared towards numerically
intensive, radiation (particle) transport applications built for
parallel computing hardware. It consists of semi-independent packages
and a robust build system.
dependent_to.name: draco

dependent_to.description: High-Order Mesh Ray Tracer.
dependent_to.name: dray

dependent_to.description: ECP Data & Vis SDK
dependent_to.name: ecp-data-vis-sdk

dependent_to.description: Elbencho storage benchmark
dependent_to.name: elbencho

dependent_to.description: Eigenvalue solvers for Petaflop-Applications (ELPA)
dependent_to.name: elpa

dependent_to.description:
ELSI provides a unified interface for electronic structure codes to a
variety of eigenvalue solvers.
dependent_to.name: elsi

dependent_to.description: The ethminer is an Ethereum GPU mining worker.
dependent_to.name: ethminer

dependent_to.description:
ExaCA: an exascale cellular automata application for alloy
solidification modeling
dependent_to.name: exaca

dependent_to.description:
ExaGO is a package for solving large-scale power grid optimization
problems on parallel and distributed architectures, particularly
targeted for exascale machines.
dependent_to.name: exago

dependent_to.description: Multi-application driver for Exawind project.
dependent_to.name: exawind

dependent_to.description:
Extrae is the package devoted to generate tracefiles which can be
analyzed later by Paraver. Extrae is a tool that uses different
interposition mechanisms to inject probes into the target application so
as to gather information regarding the application performance. The
Extrae instrumentation package can instrument the MPI programin model,
and the following parallel programming models either alone or in
conjunction with MPI : OpenMP, CUDA, OpenCL, pthread, OmpSs
dependent_to.name: extrae

dependent_to.description:
EZTrace is a tool to automatically generate execution traces of HPC
applications.
dependent_to.name: eztrace

dependent_to.description:
Faiss is a library for efficient similarity search and clustering of
dense vectors. Faiss contains algorithms that search in sets of vectors
of any size, up to ones that possibly do not fit in RAM. It also
contains supporting code for evaluation and parameter tuning. Faiss is
written in C++ with complete wrappers for Python/numpy. Some of the most
useful algorithms are implemented on the GPU. It is developed by
Facebook AI Research.
dependent_to.name: faiss

dependent_to.description:
FFTX is the exascale follow-on to the FFTW open source discrete FFT
package for executing the Fast Fourier Transform as well as higher-level
operations composed of linear operations combined with DFT transforms.
dependent_to.name: fftx

dependent_to.description:
FLANN is a library for performing fast approximate nearest neighbor
searches in high dimensional spaces. It contains a collection of
algorithms we found to work best for nearest neighbor search and a
system for automatically choosing the best algorithm and optimum
parameters depending on the dataset. FLANN is written in C++ and
contains bindings for the following languages: C, MATLAB and Python.
dependent_to.name: flann

dependent_to.description:
FleCSI is a compile-time configurable framework designed to support
multi-physics application development. As such, FleCSI attempts to
provide a very general set of infrastructure design patterns that can be
specialized and extended to suit the needs of a broad variety of solver
and data requirements. Current support includes multi-dimensional mesh
topology, mesh geometry, and mesh adjacency information.
dependent_to.name: flecsi

dependent_to.description:
FSL is a comprehensive library of analysis tools for FMRI, MRI and DTI
brain imaging data.
dependent_to.name: fsl

dependent_to.description:
FTK is a library that simplifies, scales, and delivers feature tracking
algorithms for scientific data.
dependent_to.name: ftk

dependent_to.description:
GASNet is a language-independent, networking middleware layer that
provides network-independent, high-performance communication primitives
including Remote Memory Access (RMA) and Active Messages (AM). It has
been used to implement parallel programming models and libraries
including UPC, UPC++, multi-image Fortran, Legion, Chapel, and many
others. The interface is primarily intended as a compilation target and
for use by runtime library writers (as opposed to end users), and the
primary goals are high performance, interface portability, and
expressiveness. ***NOTICE***: The GASNet library built by this Spack
package is ONLY intended for unit-testing purposes, and is generally
UNSUITABLE FOR PRODUCTION USE. The RECOMMENDED way to build GASNet is as
an embedded library as configured by the higher-level client runtime
package (UPC++, Legion, Chapel, etc), including system-specific
configuration.
dependent_to.name: gasnet

dependent_to.description: An experiment-independent HEP event data processing framework
dependent_to.name: gaudi

dependent_to.description:
The GNU Compiler Collection includes front ends for C, C++, Objective-C,
Fortran, Ada, and Go, as well as libraries for these languages.
dependent_to.name: gcc

dependent_to.description:
A fast GPU memory copy library based on NVIDIA GPUDirect RDMA
technology.
dependent_to.name: gdrcopy

dependent_to.description: Benchmark Suite for Heterogenuous FFT Implementations
dependent_to.name: gearshifft

dependent_to.description:
GENESIS is a Molecular dynamics and modeling software for bimolecular
systems such as proteins, lipids, glycans, and their complexes.
dependent_to.name: genesis

dependent_to.description: SDK for GPU accelerated genome assembly and analysis.
dependent_to.name: genomeworks

dependent_to.description:
The Global Extensible Open Power Manager (GEOPM) Service provides a user
interface for accessing hardware telemetry and settings securely. Note:
GEOPM interfaces with hardware using Model Specific Registers (MSRs).
For proper usage make sure MSRs are made available via the msr or msr-
safe kernel modules by your administrator.
dependent_to.name: geopm-service

dependent_to.description:
GHOST: a General, Hybrid and Optimized Sparse Toolkit. This library
provides highly optimized building blocks for implementing sparse
iterative eigenvalue and linear solvers multi- and manycore clusters and
on heterogenous CPU/GPU machines. For an iterative solver library using
these kernels, see the phist package.
dependent_to.name: ghost

dependent_to.description:
High-performance linear algebra library for manycore systems, with a
focus on sparse solution of linear systems.
dependent_to.name: ginkgo

dependent_to.description: Gloo is a collective communications library.
dependent_to.name: gloo

dependent_to.description:
gnina (pronounced NEE-na) is a molecular docking program with integrated
support for scoring and optimizing ligands using convolutional neural
networks.
dependent_to.name: gnina

dependent_to.description: Multi-GPU CUDA stress test.
dependent_to.name: gpu-burn

dependent_to.description:
GPUscout: A tool for discovering data movement-related bottlenecks on
NVidia GPUs.
dependent_to.name: gpuscout

dependent_to.description: High-Performance Linear Algebra-based Graph Primitives on GPUs
dependent_to.name: graphblast

dependent_to.description: Data parallel C++ mathematical object library.
dependent_to.name: grid

dependent_to.description:
GROMACS is a molecular dynamics package primarily designed for
simulations of proteins, lipids and nucleic acids. It was originally
developed in the Biophysical Chemistry department of University of
Groningen, and is now maintained by contributors in universities and
research centers across the world. GROMACS is one of the fastest and
most popular software packages available and can run on CPUs as well as
GPUs. It is free, open source released under the GNU Lesser General
Public License. Before the version 4.6, GROMACS was released under the
GNU General Public License.
dependent_to.name: gromacs

dependent_to.description:
A modification of GROMACS that implements the "chain coordinate", a
reaction coordinate for pore formation in membranes and stalk formation
between membranes.
dependent_to.name: gromacs-chain-coordinate

dependent_to.description:
Modified Gromacs for small-angle scattering calculations
(SAXS/WAXS/SANS)
dependent_to.name: gromacs-swaxs

dependent_to.description: High-Performance Graph Primitives on GPUs
dependent_to.name: gunrock

dependent_to.description: This package enables GPU Direct Storage Virtual File Driver in HDF5.
dependent_to.name: hdf5-vfd-gds

dependent_to.description: Highly Efficient FFT for Exascale
dependent_to.name: heffte

dependent_to.description: GPU accelerated transient detection pipeline
dependent_to.name: heimdall

dependent_to.description:
HiOp is an optimization solver for solving certain mathematical
optimization problems expressed as nonlinear programming problems. HiOp
is a lightweight HPC solver that leverages application"s existing data
parallelism to parallelize the optimization iterations by using
specialized linear algebra kernels.
dependent_to.name: hiop

dependent_to.description:
HIP is a C++ Runtime API and Kernel Language that allows developers to
create portable applications for AMD and NVIDIA GPUs from single source
code.
dependent_to.name: hip

dependent_to.description:
Highly efficient Plasma Accelerator Emulation, quasistatic particle-in-
cell code
dependent_to.name: hipace

dependent_to.description: hipBLAS is a BLAS marshalling library, with multiple supported backends
dependent_to.name: hipblas

dependent_to.description: Radeon Open Compute Parallel Primitives Library
dependent_to.name: hipcub

dependent_to.description:
hipFFT is an FFT marshalling library. Currently, hipFFT supports either
rocFFT or cuFFT as backends.hipFFT exports an interface that does not
require the client to change, regardless of the chosen backend. It sits
between the application and the backend FFT library, marshalling inputs
into the backend and results back to the application.
dependent_to.name: hipfft

dependent_to.description:
The hipRAND project provides an interface for generating pseudo-random
and quasi-random numbers with either cuRAND or rocRAND backends.
dependent_to.name: hiprand

dependent_to.description:
hipSOLVER is a LAPACK marshalling library, with multiple supported
backends. It sits between the application and a 'worker' LAPACK library,
marshalling inputs into the backend library and marshalling results back
to the application. hipSOLVER exports an interface that does not require
the client to change, regardless of the chosen backend. Currently,
hipSOLVER supports rocSOLVER and cuSOLVER as backends.
dependent_to.name: hipsolver

dependent_to.description:
hipSPARSE is a SPARSE marshalling library, with multiple supported
backends
dependent_to.name: hipsparse

dependent_to.description:
hipSYCL is an implementation of the SYCL standard programming model over
NVIDIA CUDA/AMD HIP
dependent_to.name: hipsycl

dependent_to.description:
HOOMD-blue is a general-purpose particle simulation toolkit. It scales
from a single CPU core to thousands of GPUs. You define particle initial
conditions and interactions in a high-level python script. Then tell
HOOMD-blue how you want to execute the job and it takes care of the
rest. Python job scripts give you unlimited flexibility to create custom
initialization routines, control simulation parameters, and perform in
situ analysis.
dependent_to.name: hoomd-blue

dependent_to.description:
HPCToolkit is an integrated suite of tools for measurement and analysis
of program performance on computers ranging from multicore desktop
systems to the nation's largest supercomputers. By using statistical
sampling of timers and hardware performance counters, HPCToolkit
collects accurate measurements of a program's work, resource
consumption, and inefficiency and attributes them to the full calling
context in which they occur.
dependent_to.name: hpctoolkit

dependent_to.description:
HPGMG implements full multigrid (FMG) algorithms using finite-volume and
finite-element methods. Different algorithmic variants adjust the
arithmetic intensity and architectural properties that are tested. These
FMG methods converge up to discretization error in one F-cycle, thus may
be considered direct solvers. An F-cycle visits the finest level a total
of two times, the first coarsening (8x smaller) 4 times, the second
coarsening 6 times, etc.
dependent_to.name: hpgmg

dependent_to.description: C++ runtime system for parallel and distributed applications.
dependent_to.name: hpx

dependent_to.description: HPXKokkos is an interoperability library for HPX and Kokkos
dependent_to.name: hpx-kokkos

dependent_to.description:
The Hardware Locality (hwloc) software project. The Portable Hardware
Locality (hwloc) software package provides a portable abstraction
(across OS, versions, architectures, ...) of the hierarchical topology
of modern architectures, including NUMA memory nodes, sockets, shared
caches, cores and simultaneous multithreading. It also gathers various
system attributes such as cache and memory information as well as the
locality of I/O devices such as network interfaces, InfiniBand HCAs or
GPUs. It primarily aims at helping applications with gathering
information about modern computing hardware so as to exploit it
accordingly and efficiently.
dependent_to.name: hwloc

dependent_to.description:
Hydrogen: Distributed-memory dense and sparse-direct linear algebra and
optimization library. Based on the Elemental library.
dependent_to.name: hydrogen

dependent_to.description:
Hypre is a library of high performance preconditioners that features
parallel multigrid methods for both structured and unstructured grid
problems.
dependent_to.name: hypre

dependent_to.description:
Hypre is a library of high performance preconditioners that features
parallel multigrid methods for both structured and unstructured grid
problems.
dependent_to.name: hypre-cmake

dependent_to.description:
ICON - is a modeling framework for weather, climate, and environmental
prediction. It solves the full three-dimensional non-hydrostatic and
compressible Navier-Stokes equations on an icosahedral grid and allows
seamless predictions from local to global scales.
dependent_to.name: icon

dependent_to.description:
IPM is a portable profiling infrastructure for parallel codes. It
provides a low-overhead profile of application performance and resource
utilization in a parallel program. Communication, computation, and IO
are the primary focus.
dependent_to.name: ipm

dependent_to.description: In Situ Animation of Accelerated Computations: Header-Only Library
dependent_to.name: isaac

dependent_to.description:
Kaldi is a toolkit for speech recognition written in C++ and licensed
under the Apache License v2.0. Kaldi is intended for use by speech
recognition researchers.
dependent_to.name: kaldi

dependent_to.description:
A CPU+GPU Profiling library that provides access to timeline traces and
hardware performance counters.
dependent_to.name: kineto

dependent_to.description:
Kokkos implements a programming model in C++ for writing performance
portable applications targeting all major HPC platforms.
dependent_to.name: kokkos

dependent_to.description:
Kokkos Kernels provides math kernels, often BLAS or LAPACK for small
matrices, that can be used in larger Kokkos parallel routines
dependent_to.name: kokkos-kernels

dependent_to.description:
Kokkos implements a programming model in C++ for writing performance
portable applications targeting all major HPC platforms.
dependent_to.name: kokkos-legacy

dependent_to.description:
The NVCC wrapper provides a wrapper around NVCC to make it a 'full' C++
compiler that accepts all flags
dependent_to.name: kokkos-nvcc-wrapper

dependent_to.description:
Kripke is a simple, scalable, 3D Sn deterministic particle transport
proxy/mini app.
dependent_to.name: kripke

dependent_to.description:
LAMMPS stands for Large-scale Atomic/Molecular Massively Parallel
Simulator.
dependent_to.name: lammps

dependent_to.description:
LAPACK++: C++ API for the LAPACK Linear Algebra Package. Developed by
the Innovative Computing Laboratory at the University of Tennessee,
Knoxville.
dependent_to.name: lapackpp

dependent_to.description:
LBANN: Livermore Big Artificial Neural Network Toolkit. A distributed
memory, HPC-optimized, model and data parallel training toolkit for deep
neural networks.
dependent_to.name: lbann

dependent_to.description:
a framework for automatically creating high-speed lossless and error-
bounded lossy data compression and decompression algorithms.
dependent_to.name: lc-framework

dependent_to.description:
Legion is a data-centric parallel programming system for writing
portable high performance programs targeted at distributed heterogeneous
architectures. Legion presents abstractions which allow programmers to
describe properties of program data (e.g. independence, locality). By
making the Legion programming system aware of the structure of program
data, it can automate many of the tedious tasks programmers currently
face, including correctly extracting task- and data-level parallelism
and moving data around complex memory hierarchies. A novel mapping
interface provides explicit programmer controlled placement of data in
the memory hierarchy and assignment of tasks to processors in a way that
is orthogonal to correctness, thereby enabling easy porting and tuning
of Legion applications to new architectures.
dependent_to.name: legion

dependent_to.description:
Beagle performs genotype calling, genotype phasing, imputation of
ungenotyped markers, and identity-by-descent segment detection.
dependent_to.name: libbeagle

dependent_to.description: The CEED API Library: Code for Efficient Extensible Discretizations.
dependent_to.name: libceed

dependent_to.description:
Built based on the Apache Arrow columnar memory format, cuDF is a GPU
DataFrame library for loading, joining, aggregating, filtering, and
otherwise manipulating data.
dependent_to.name: libcudf

dependent_to.description:
cuML is a suite of libraries that implement machine learning algorithms
and mathematical primitives functions that share compatible APIs with
other RAPIDS projects.
dependent_to.name: libcuml

dependent_to.description: libcuMLPrims library
dependent_to.name: libcumlprims

dependent_to.description:
The CXI library provides interfaces which interact directly with CXI
drivers.
dependent_to.name: libcxi

dependent_to.description:
The Open Fabrics Interfaces (OFI) is a framework focused on exporting
fabric communication services to applications.
dependent_to.name: libfabric

dependent_to.description:
Make a common GPU ndarray(n dimensions array) that can be reused by all
projects that is as future proof as possible, while keeping it easy to
use for simple need/quick test.
dependent_to.name: libgpuarray

dependent_to.description:
libmolgrid is a library to generate tensors from molecular data, with
properties that make its output particularly suited to machine learning.
dependent_to.name: libmolgrid

dependent_to.description: A generic abstraction for the compression of dense tensors
dependent_to.name: libpressio

dependent_to.description: LibPressio Bindings for NVCOMP
dependent_to.name: libpressio-nvcomp

dependent_to.description:
RMM: RAPIDS Memory Manager. Achieving optimal performance in GPU-centric
workflows frequently requires customizing how host and device memory are
allocated.
dependent_to.name: librmm

dependent_to.description:
Libxc is a library of exchange-correlation functionals for density-
functional theory.
dependent_to.name: libxc

dependent_to.description:
Likwid is a simple to install and use toolsuite of command line
applications for performance oriented programmers. It works for Intel
and AMD processors on the Linux operating system. This version uses the
perf_event backend which reduces the feature set but allows user
installs. See https://github.com/RRZE-
HPC/likwid/wiki/TutorialLikwidPerf#feature-limitations for information.
dependent_to.name: likwid

dependent_to.description:
The LLVM Project is a collection of modular and reusable compiler and
toolchain technologies. Despite its name, LLVM has little to do with
traditional virtual machines, though it does provide helpful libraries
that can be used to build them. The name "LLVM" itself is not an
acronym; it is the full name of the project.
dependent_to.name: llvm

dependent_to.description:
This package provides a collection of the experimental LLVM projects
done by the US DOE research and development teams.
dependent_to.name: llvm-doe

dependent_to.description: LvArray portable HPC containers.
dependent_to.name: lvarray

dependent_to.description:
The MAGMA project aims to develop a dense linear algebra library similar
to LAPACK but for heterogeneous/hybrid architectures, starting with
current "Multicore+GPU" systems.
dependent_to.name: magma

dependent_to.description:
mallocMC: Memory Allocator for Many Core Architectures. This project
provides a framework for fast memory managers on many core accelerators.
Currently, it supports NVIDIA GPUs of compute capability sm_20 or higher
through the ScatterAlloc algorithm. mallocMC is header-only, but
requires a few other C++ libraries to be available.
dependent_to.name: mallocmc

dependent_to.description:
an ultra-high-performance protein-protein docking for heterogeneous
supercomputers
dependent_to.name: megadock

dependent_to.description: Free, lightweight, scalable C++ library for finite element methods.
dependent_to.name: mfem

dependent_to.description:
MGARD error bounded lossy compressor For versions up to 2023-12-09, uses
a fork from https://github.com/robertu94/MGARD with patches to support
Spack. For versions after 2023-12-09, uses the upstream repository at
https://github.com/CODARcode/MGARD directly from the master branch.
dependent_to.name: mgard

dependent_to.description:
MLC LLM is a machine learning compiler and high-performance deployment
engine for large language models. The mission of this project is to
enable everyone to develop, optimize, and deploy AI models natively on
everyone's platforms.
dependent_to.name: mlc-llm

dependent_to.description:
PyTorch implementation for the climate segmentation benchmark, based on
the Exascale Deep Learning for Climate Analytics
dependent_to.name: mlperf-deepcam

dependent_to.description:
MotionCor2 is a multi-GPU program that corrects beam-induced sample
motion recorded on dose fractionated movie stacks. It implements a
robust iterative alignment algorithm that delivers precise measurement
and correction of both global and non-uniform local motions at single
pixel level, suitable for both single-particle and tomographic images.
MotionCor2 is sufficiently fast to keep up with automated data
collection.
dependent_to.name: motioncor2

dependent_to.description:
MPICH is a high performance and widely portable implementation of the
Message Passing Interface (MPI) standard.
dependent_to.name: mpich

dependent_to.description: GPU accelerated micromagnetic simulator.
dependent_to.name: mumax

dependent_to.description:
Mvapich is a High-Performance MPI Library for clusters with diverse
networks (InfiniBand, Omni-Path, Ethernet/iWARP, and RoCE) and computing
platforms (x86 (Intel and AMD), ARM and OpenPOWER)
dependent_to.name: mvapich

dependent_to.description:
Mvapich is a High-Performance MPI Library for clusters with diverse
networks (InfiniBand, Omni-Path, Ethernet/iWARP, and RoCE) and computing
platforms (x86 (Intel and AMD), ARM and OpenPOWER)
dependent_to.name: mvapich-plus

dependent_to.description:
Mvapich2 is a High-Performance MPI Library for clusters with diverse
networks (InfiniBand, Omni-Path, Ethernet/iWARP, and RoCE) and computing
platforms (x86 (Intel and AMD), ARM and OpenPOWER)
dependent_to.name: mvapich2

dependent_to.description:
MVAPICH2-GDR is an optimized version of the MVAPICH2 MPI library for
GPU-enabled HPC and Deep Learning Applications. MVAPICH2-GDR is not
installable from source and is only available through a binary mirror.
If you do not find the binary you're looking for, send us an email at
mvapich@cse.ohio-state.edu. The binary mirror url is:
http://mvapich.cse.ohio-state.edu/download/mvapich/spack-
mirror/mvapich2-gdr/
dependent_to.name: mvapich2-gdr

dependent_to.description:
MXNet is a deep learning framework designed for both efficiency and
flexibility.
dependent_to.name: mxnet

dependent_to.description: Nalu-Wind: Wind energy focused variant of Nalu.
dependent_to.name: nalu-wind

dependent_to.description:
NAMD is a parallel molecular dynamics code designed for high-performance
simulation of large biomolecular systems.
dependent_to.name: namd

dependent_to.description: Optimized primitives for collective multi-GPU communication.
dependent_to.name: nccl

dependent_to.description:
These tests check both the performance and the correctness of NCCL
operations.
dependent_to.name: nccl-tests

dependent_to.description:
A High-Throughput Parallel Lossless Compressor for Scientific Data
forked from: https://github.com/fknorr/ndzip
dependent_to.name: ndzip

dependent_to.description:
Neko: A modern, portable, and scalable framework for high-fidelity
computational fluid dynamics
dependent_to.name: neko

dependent_to.description:
nekRS is an open-source Navier Stokes solver based on the spectral
element method targeting classical processors and hardware accelerators
like GPUs
dependent_to.name: nekrs

dependent_to.description: NeoN is a PDE solver for CFD frameworks.
dependent_to.name: neon

dependent_to.description:
NEURON is a simulation environment for single and networks of neurons.
NEURON is a simulation environment for modeling individual and networks
of neurons. NEURON models individual neurons via the use of sections
that are automatically subdivided into individual compartments, instead
of requiring the user to manually create compartments.
dependent_to.name: neuron

dependent_to.description: Nonlinear CG methods for wave-function optimization in DFT.
dependent_to.name: nlcglib

dependent_to.description: nvbandwidth: A tool for bandwidth measurements on NVIDIA GPUs.
dependent_to.name: nvbandwidth

dependent_to.description:
Last open source release of A library for fast lossless compression
/decompression on NVIDIA GPUs forked from:
https://github.com/NVIDIA/nvcomp after NVIDIA made this closed source
dependent_to.name: nvcomp

dependent_to.description:
nvptx-tools: A collection of tools for use with nvptx-none GCC
toolchains. These tools are necessary when building a version of GCC
that enables offloading of OpenMP/OpenACC code to NVIDIA GPUs.
dependent_to.name: nvptx-tools

dependent_to.description:
NVSHMEM is a parallel programming interface based on OpenSHMEM that
provides efficient and scalable communication for NVIDIA GPU clusters.
NVSHMEM creates a global address space for data that spans the memory of
multiple GPUs and can be accessed with fine-grained GPU-initiated
operations, CPU-initiated operations, and operations on CUDA streams.
dependent_to.name: nvshmem

dependent_to.description:
Nvtop stands for Neat Videocard TOP, a (h)top like task monitor for AMD
and NVIDIA GPUS. It can handle multiple GPUs and print information about
them in a htop familiar way
dependent_to.name: nvtop

dependent_to.description: High-performance computational chemistry software
dependent_to.name: nwchem

dependent_to.description:
OCCA is an open-source (MIT license) library used to program current
multi-core/many-core architectures. Devices (such as CPUs, GPUs, Intel's
Xeon Phi, FPGAs, etc) are abstracted using an offload-model for
application development and programming for the devices is done through
a C-based (OKL) or Fortran-based kernel language (OFL). OCCA gives
developers the ability to target devices at run-time by using run-time
compilation for device kernels.
dependent_to.name: occa

dependent_to.description:
A real-space finite-difference (time-dependent) density-functional
theory code.
dependent_to.name: octopus

dependent_to.description:
Run Llama 2, Code Llama, and other models. Customize and create your
own.
dependent_to.name: ollama

dependent_to.description:
Omega_h is a C++11 library providing data structures and algorithms for
adaptive discretizations. Its specialty is anisotropic triangle and
tetrahedral mesh adaptation. It runs efficiently on most modern HPC
hardware including GPUs.
dependent_to.name: omega-h

dependent_to.description: Guppy: local accelerated basecalling for Nanopore data
dependent_to.name: ont-guppy

dependent_to.description:
OP2 is a high-level embedded domain specific language for writing
unstructured mesh algorithms with automatic parallelisation on multi-
core and many-core architectures.
dependent_to.name: op2-dsl

dependent_to.description: Omni-Path Performance Scaled Messaging 2 (PSM2) library
dependent_to.name: opa-psm2

dependent_to.description: Open3D: A Modern Library for 3D Data Processing.
dependent_to.name: open3d

dependent_to.description:
OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision Library) is an open source computer
vision and machine learning software library.
dependent_to.name: opencv

dependent_to.description:
A high performance toolkit for molecular simulation. Use it as a
library, or as an application. We include extensive language bindings
for Python, C, C++, and even Fortran. The code is open source and
actively maintained on Github, licensed under MIT and LGPL. Part of the
Omnia suite of tools for predictive biomolecular simulation.
dependent_to.name: openmm

dependent_to.description:
An open source Message Passing Interface implementation. The Open MPI
Project is an open source Message Passing Interface implementation that
is developed and maintained by a consortium of academic, research, and
industry partners. Open MPI is therefore able to combine the expertise,
technologies, and resources from all across the High Performance
Computing community in order to build the best MPI library available.
Open MPI offers advantages for system and software vendors, application
developers and computer science researchers.
dependent_to.name: openmpi

dependent_to.description:
OpenSubdiv is a set of open source libraries that implement high
performance subdivision surface (subdiv) evaluation on massively
parallel CPU and GPU architectures. This code path is optimized for
drawing deforming surfaces with static topology at interactive
framerates.
dependent_to.name: opensubdiv

dependent_to.description: An open-source wind turbine structural dynamics simulation code.
dependent_to.name: openturbine

dependent_to.description:
The Ohio MicroBenchmark suite is a collection of independent MPI message
passing performance microbenchmarks developed and written at The Ohio
State University. It includes traditional benchmarks and performance
measures such as latency, bandwidth and host overhead and can be used
for both traditional and GPU-enhanced nodes.
dependent_to.name: osu-micro-benchmarks

dependent_to.description:
PAPI provides the tool designer and application engineer with a
consistent interface and methodology for use of the performance counter
hardware found in most major microprocessors. PAPI enables software
engineers to see, in near real time, the relation between software
performance and processor events. In addition Component PAPI provides
access to a collection of components that expose performance measurement
opportunities across the hardware and software stack.
dependent_to.name: papi

dependent_to.description:
ParaView is an open-source, multi-platform data analysis and
visualization application. This package includes the Catalyst in-situ
library for versions 5.7 and greater, otherwise use the catalyst
package.
dependent_to.name: paraview

dependent_to.description:
PaRSEC: the Parallel Runtime Scheduler and Execution Controller PaRSEC
is a runtime and a programming toolbox that support the design and
parallel execution of micro-tasks on distributed, heterogeneous systems.
dependent_to.name: parsec

dependent_to.description:
a high performance parallel solver for very large sparse linear systems
based on direct methods
dependent_to.name: pastix

dependent_to.description:
PETSc is a suite of data structures and routines for the scalable
(parallel) solution of scientific applications modeled by partial
differential equations.
dependent_to.name: petsc

dependent_to.description: C++ runtime system for parallellism and concurrency.
dependent_to.name: pika

dependent_to.description:
plsm is a generic library for spatial subdivision within an
N-dimensional lattice.
dependent_to.name: plsm

dependent_to.description:
ProfugusMC is a Monte Carlo radiation transport mini-app. It is designed
to be a minimal, self-contained version of the Profugus application.
dependent_to.name: profugusmc

dependent_to.description:
PSBLAS: Parallel Sparse BLAS. A library of distributed sparse linear
algebra with support for GPU and Multithread acceleration. Part of the
PSCToolkit: Parallel Sparse Computation Toolkit.
dependent_to.name: psblas

dependent_to.description: Open source software to process some types of astronomy data.
dependent_to.name: psrdada

dependent_to.description:
AlphaFold is an AI system developed by DeepMind that predicts a
protein's 3D structure from its amino acid sequence. It regularly
achieves accuracy competitive with experiment.
dependent_to.name: py-alphafold

dependent_to.description: AMReX Python Bindings with pybind11
dependent_to.name: py-amrex

dependent_to.description:
Charm4py (Charm++ for Python) is a distributed computing and parallel
programming framework for Python, for the productive development of
fast, parallel and scalable applications. It is built on top of Charm++,
a C++ adaptive runtime system that has seen extensive use in the
scientific and high-performance computing (HPC) communities across many
disciplines, and has been used to develop applications that run on a
wide range of devices: from small multi-core devices up to the largest
supercomputers.
dependent_to.name: py-charm4py

dependent_to.description:
Built based on the Apache Arrow columnar memory format, cuDF is a GPU
DataFrame library for loading, joining, aggregating, filtering, and
otherwise manipulating data.
dependent_to.name: py-cudf

dependent_to.description:
cuML is a suite of libraries that implement machine learning algorithms
and mathematical primitives functions that share compatible APIs with
other RAPIDS projects.
dependent_to.name: py-cuml

dependent_to.description:
CuPy is an open-source array library accelerated with NVIDIA CUDA. CuPy
provides GPU accelerated computing with Python. CuPy uses CUDA-related
libraries including cuBLAS, cuDNN, cuRand, cuSolver, cuSPARSE, cuFFT and
NCCL to make full use of the GPU architecture.
dependent_to.name: py-cupy

dependent_to.description:
Deep Graph Library (DGL). DGL is an easy-to-use, high performance and
scalable Python package for deep learning on graphs. DGL is framework
agnostic, meaning if a deep graph model is a component of an end-to-end
application, the rest of the logics can be implemented in any major
frameworks, such as PyTorch, Apache MXNet or TensorFlow.
dependent_to.name: py-dgl

dependent_to.description:
Optimizing Protein Structure Prediction Model Training and Inference on
GPU Clusters.
dependent_to.name: py-fastfold

dependent_to.description:
Horovod is a distributed deep learning training framework for
TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, and Apache MXNet.
dependent_to.name: py-horovod

dependent_to.description:
XLA library for Jax. jaxlib is the support library for JAX. While JAX
itself is a pure Python package, jaxlib contains the binary (C/C++)
parts of the library, including Python bindings, the XLA compiler, the
PJRT runtime, and a handful of handwritten kernels.
dependent_to.name: py-jaxlib

dependent_to.description:
MELD is a tool for inferring the structure of biomolecules from sparse,
ambiguous, or noisy data.
dependent_to.name: py-meldmd

dependent_to.description:
Melissa is a file-avoiding, adaptive, fault-tolerant and elastic
framework, to run large-scale sensitivity analysis or deep-surrogate
training on supercomputers. This package builds the launcher and server
modules.
dependent_to.name: py-melissa-core

dependent_to.description:
The MinkowskiEngine is an auto-differentiation library for sparse
tensors.
dependent_to.name: py-minkowskiengine

dependent_to.description:
Zero-copy MPI communication of JAX arrays, for turbo-charged HPC
applications in Python.
dependent_to.name: py-mpi4jax

dependent_to.description:
A GPU-accelerated library containing highly optimized building blocks
and an execution engine for data processing to accelerate deep learning
training and inference applications.
dependent_to.name: py-nvidia-dali

dependent_to.description:
ONNX Runtime is a performance-focused complete scoring engine for Open
Neural Network Exchange (ONNX) models, with an open extensible
architecture to continually address the latest developments in AI and
Deep Learning. ONNX Runtime stays up to date with the ONNX standard with
complete implementation of all ONNX operators, and supports all ONNX
releases (1.2+) with both future and backwards compatibility.
dependent_to.name: py-onnxruntime

dependent_to.description:
The PennyLane-Lightning-Kokkos plugin provides a fast state-vector
simulator with Kokkos kernels.
dependent_to.name: py-pennylane-lightning-kokkos

dependent_to.description:
PyCUDA gives you easy, Pythonic access to Nvidia's CUDA parallel
computation API
dependent_to.name: py-pycuda

dependent_to.description:
PyFR is an open-source Python based framework for solving advection-
diffusion type problems on streaming architectures using the Flux
Reconstruction approach of Huynh.
dependent_to.name: py-pyfr

dependent_to.description:
Aer is a high performance simulator for quantum circuits that includes
noise models
dependent_to.name: py-qiskit-aer

dependent_to.description:
RMM: RAPIDS Memory Manager. Achieving optimal performance in GPU-centric
workflows frequently requires customizing how host and device memory are
allocated.
dependent_to.name: py-rmm

dependent_to.description: SCS: splitting conic solver
dependent_to.name: py-scs

dependent_to.description: TensorFlow is an open source machine learning framework for everyone.
dependent_to.name: py-tensorflow

dependent_to.description: Tensorflow plugin for DLPack.
dependent_to.name: py-tfdlpack

dependent_to.description:
Optimizing compiler for evaluating mathematical expressions on CPUs and
GPUs.
dependent_to.name: py-theano

dependent_to.description:
TomoPy is an open-source Python package for tomographic data processing
and image reconstruction.
dependent_to.name: py-tomopy

dependent_to.description:
Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU
acceleration.
dependent_to.name: py-torch

dependent_to.description:
A PyTorch Extension: Tools for easy mixed precision and distributed
training in Pytorch
dependent_to.name: py-torch-nvidia-apex

dependent_to.description: Image and video datasets and models for torch deep learning.
dependent_to.name: py-torchvision

dependent_to.description:
QMCPACK, is a modern high-performance open-source Quantum Monte Carlo
(QMC) simulation code.
dependent_to.name: qmcpack

dependent_to.description:
a software package for the solution of sparse, linear systems on
multicore computers based on the QR factorization of the input matrix.
dependent_to.name: qrmumps

dependent_to.description: Optimal control for open quantum systems
dependent_to.name: quandary

dependent_to.description:
Quantum ESPRESSO is an integrated suite of Open-Source computer codes
for electronic-structure calculations and materials modeling at the
nanoscale. It is based on density-functional theory, plane waves, and
pseudopotentials.
dependent_to.name: quantum-espresso

dependent_to.description: QUDA is a library for performing calculations in lattice QCD on GPUs.
dependent_to.name: quda

dependent_to.description:
A cross-stack coordination layer to dynamically map runtime components
to hardware resources
dependent_to.name: quo-vadis

dependent_to.description:
RAFT: Reconstruct Algorithms for Tomography. Toolbox under development
at Brazilian Synchrotron Light Source.
dependent_to.name: raft

dependent_to.description: RAJA Parallel Framework.
dependent_to.name: raja

dependent_to.description: RAJA Performance Suite.
dependent_to.name: raja-perf

dependent_to.description: Extensible, performance-portable solid mechanics with libCEED and PETSc
dependent_to.name: ratel

dependent_to.description: A Redis module for serving tensors and executing deep learning graphs
dependent_to.name: redis-ai

dependent_to.description: Create MPI communicators for disparate redundancy sets
dependent_to.name: redset

dependent_to.description:
RELION (for REgularised LIkelihood OptimisatioN, pronounce rely-on) is a
stand-alone computer program that employs an empirical Bayesian approach
to refinement of (multiple) 3D reconstructions or 2D class averages in
electron cryo-microscopy (cryo-EM).
dependent_to.name: relion

dependent_to.description:
ReSolve is a library of GPU-resident sparse linear solvers. It contains
iterative and direct solvers designed to run on NVIDIA and AMD GPUs, as
well as CPU devices.
dependent_to.name: resolve

dependent_to.description:
RMGDFT is a high performance real-space density functional code designed
for large scale electronic structure calculations.
dependent_to.name: rmgdft

dependent_to.description: Rodinia: Accelerating Compute-Intensive Applications with Accelerators
dependent_to.name: rodinia

dependent_to.description: ROOT is a data analysis framework.
dependent_to.name: root

dependent_to.description:
The Score-P measurement infrastructure is a highly scalable and easy-to-
use tool suite for profiling, event tracing, and online analysis of HPC
applications.
dependent_to.name: scorep

dependent_to.description: A C package that solves convex cone problems via operator splitting
dependent_to.name: scs

dependent_to.description:
Seissol - A scientific software for the numerical simulation of seismic
wave phenomena and earthquake dynamics.
dependent_to.name: seissol

dependent_to.description:
Singularity-EOS: A collection of closure models and tools useful for
multiphysics codes.
dependent_to.name: singularity-eos

dependent_to.description: Domain specific library for electronic structure calculations
dependent_to.name: sirius

dependent_to.description:
The Software for Linear Algebra Targeting Exascale (SLATE) project
provides fundamental dense linear algebra capabilities to the US
Department of Energy and to the high-performance computing (HPC)
community at large. To this end, SLATE provides basic dense matrix
operations (e.g., matrix multiplication, rank-k update, triangular
solve), linear systems solvers, least square solvers, singular value and
eigenvalue solvers.
dependent_to.name: slate

dependent_to.description: Scalable Library for Eigenvalue Problem Computations.
dependent_to.name: slepc

dependent_to.description:
Slurm is an open source, fault-tolerant, and highly scalable cluster
management and job scheduling system for large and small Linux clusters.
Slurm requires no kernel modifications for its operation and is
relatively self-contained. As a cluster workload manager, Slurm has
three key functions. First, it allocates exclusive and/or non-exclusive
access to resources (compute nodes) to users for some duration of time
so they can perform work. Second, it provides a framework for starting,
executing, and monitoring work (normally a parallel job) on the set of
allocated nodes. Finally, it arbitrates contention for resources by
managing a queue of pending work.
dependent_to.name: slurm

dependent_to.description: A microbenchmark for timing Gather/Scatter kernels on CPUs and GPUs.
dependent_to.name: spatter

dependent_to.description:
Program specfem3D from SPECFEM3D_GLOBE is a 3-D spectral-element solver
for the Earth. It uses a mesh generated by program meshfem3D.
dependent_to.name: specfem3d-globe

dependent_to.description: Sparse 3D FFT library with MPI, OpenMP, CUDA and ROCm support.
dependent_to.name: spfft

dependent_to.description: SPH and N-body simulation framework
dependent_to.name: sphexa

dependent_to.description:
Specialized Parallel Linear Algebra, providing distributed GEMM
functionality for specific matrix distributions with optional GPU
acceleration.
dependent_to.name: spla

dependent_to.description:
StarPU runtime system StarPU is a runtime support for scheduling
applications written as task graphs on heterogeneous multi-core
architectures. Tasks may define several implementations, for different
architectures (e.g one implementation for CPUs, and one implementation
for CUDA). StarPU takes care of scheduling and executing those tasks as
efficiently as possible over the entire machine. It also provides a
high-level data management library which enforces memory coherency over
the differents processing units of the machine, and over a cluster when
using distributed computing. Various data structures are supported
mainline (vectors, dense matrices, CSR/BCSR/COO sparse matrices, ...),
but application-specific data structures can also be supported.
dependent_to.name: starpu

dependent_to.description:
STRUMPACK -- STRUctured Matrix PACKage - provides linear solvers for
sparse matrices and for dense rank-structured matrices, i.e., matrices
that exhibit some kind of low-rank property. It provides a distributed
memory fully algebraic sparse solver and preconditioner. The
preconditioner is mostly aimed at large sparse linear systems which
result from the discretization of a partial differential equation, but
is not limited to any particular type of problem. STRUMPACK also
provides preconditioned GMRES and BiCGStab iterative solvers.
dependent_to.name: strumpack

dependent_to.description: SuiteSparse is a suite of sparse matrix algorithms
dependent_to.name: suite-sparse

dependent_to.description:
SUNDIALS (SUite of Nonlinear and DIfferential/ALgebraic equation
Solvers)
dependent_to.name: sundials

dependent_to.description:
A general purpose library for the direct solution of large, sparse,
nonsymmetric systems of linear equations on high performance machines.
dependent_to.name: superlu-dist

dependent_to.description:
Sw4lite is a bare bone version of SW4 intended for testing performance
optimizations in a few important numerical kernels of SW4.
dependent_to.name: sw4lite

dependent_to.description:
symPACK is a sparse symmetric matrix direct linear solver, with optional
support for CUDA devices
dependent_to.name: sympack

dependent_to.description:
A library for capturing hardware topology and attributes of compute
systems.
dependent_to.name: sys-sage

dependent_to.description: An ultra fast error bounded compressor for scientific datasets
dependent_to.name: szx

dependent_to.description:
Tandem is a scientific software for SEAS modelling and for solving
Poisson and linear elasticity problems. It implements the Symmetric
Interior Penalty Galerkin (SIPG) method using unstructured simplicial
meshes (triangle meshes in 2D, tetrahedral meshes in 3D).
dependent_to.name: tandem

dependent_to.description:
The Toolkit for Adaptive Stochastic Modeling and Non-Intrusive
ApproximatioN is a robust library for high dimensional integration and
interpolation as well as parameter calibration.
dependent_to.name: tasmanian

dependent_to.description:
A portable profiling and tracing toolkit for performance analysis of
parallel programs written in Fortran, C, C++, UPC, Java, Python.
dependent_to.name: tau

dependent_to.description:
Matrix multiplication on GPUs for matrices stored on a CPU. Similar to
cublasXt, but ported to both NVIDIA and AMD GPUs.
dependent_to.name: tiled-mm

dependent_to.description:
Modular profiling toolkit and suite of libraries and tools for
C/C++/Fortran/CUDA/Python
dependent_to.name: timemory

dependent_to.description:
Tiramisu is a polyhedral compiler for dense and sparse deep learning and
data parallel algorithms.It provides a simple C++ API for expressing
algorithms and how these algorithms should be optimized by the compiler.
dependent_to.name: tiramisu

dependent_to.description:
The Trilinos Project is an effort to develop algorithms and enabling
technologies within an object-oriented software framework for the
solution of large-scale, complex multi-physics engineering and
scientific problems. A unique design feature of Trilinos is its focus on
packages.
dependent_to.name: trilinos

dependent_to.description:
UCC is a collective communication operations API and library that is
flexible, complete, and feature-rich for current and emerging
programming models and runtimes.
dependent_to.name: ucc

dependent_to.description:
a communication library implementing high-performance messaging for
MPI/PGAS frameworks
dependent_to.name: ucx

dependent_to.description:
An application-focused API for memory management on NUMA & GPU
architectures
dependent_to.name: umpire

dependent_to.description:
UPC++ is a C++ library that supports Partitioned Global Address Space
(PGAS) programming, and is designed to interoperate smoothly and
efficiently with MPI, OpenMP, CUDA, ROCm/HIP and AMTs. It leverages
GASNet-EX to deliver low-overhead, fine-grained communication, including
Remote Memory Access (RMA) and Remote Procedure Call (RPC).
dependent_to.name: upcxx

dependent_to.description:
VACUUMMS: (Void Analysis Codes and Unix Utilities for Molecular Modeling
and Simulation) is a collection of research codes for the compuational
analysis of free volume in molecular structures, including the
generation of code for the production of high quality ray-traced images
and videos. Note that production of the images from the generated code
is considered post-processing and requires POVRay and feh (on X11
systems) as post-processing dependencies. VACUUMMS has been tested under
Linux on x86_64 and ARM64. Please submit questions, pull requests, and
bug reports via github.
https://dl.acm.org/doi/abs/10.1145/2335755.2335826
dependent_to.name: vacuumms

dependent_to.description:
The Vienna Ab initio Simulation Package (VASP) is a computer program
for atomic scale materials modelling, e.g. electronic structure
calculations and quantum-mechanical molecular dynamics, from first
principles.
dependent_to.name: vasp

dependent_to.description:
The vectorized geometry library for particle-detector simulation
(toolkits).
dependent_to.name: vecgeom

dependent_to.description: VecMem is a vectorised data model base and helper classes.
dependent_to.name: vecmem

dependent_to.description:
Viskores is a toolkit of scientific visualization algorithms for
emerging processor architectures. Viskores supports the fine-grained
concurrency for data analysis and visualization algorithms required to
drive extreme scale computing by providing abstract models for data and
execution that can be applied to a variety of algorithms across many
different processor architectures.
dependent_to.name: viskores

dependent_to.description:
VTK-h is a toolkit of scientific visualization algorithms for emerging
processor architectures. VTK-h brings together several projects like
VTK-m and DIY2 to provide a toolkit with hybrid parallel capabilities.
dependent_to.name: vtk-h

dependent_to.description:
VTK-m is a toolkit of scientific visualization algorithms for emerging
processor architectures. VTK-m supports the fine-grained concurrency for
data analysis and visualization algorithms required to drive extreme
scale computing by providing abstract models for data and execution that
can be applied to a variety of algorithms across many different
processor architectures.
dependent_to.name: vtk-m

dependent_to.description:
WarpX is an advanced electromagnetic Particle-In-Cell code. It supports
many features including Perfectly-Matched Layers (PML) and mesh
refinement. In addition, WarpX is a highly-parallel and highly-optimized
code and features hybrid GPU/OpenMP/MPI parallelization and load
balancing capabilities.
dependent_to.name: warpx

dependent_to.description: whip is a small C++ abstraction layer for CUDA and HIP.
dependent_to.name: whip

dependent_to.description:
Wonton is a support package for the Portage
(https://github.com/laristra/portage) and Tangram
(https://github.com/laristra/tangram) libraries. It contains some
mesh/state classes, wrappers for other mesh/state libraries and some
utilities required by Portage and Tangram.
dependent_to.name: wonton

dependent_to.description:
XGBoost is an optimized distributed gradient boosting library designed
to be highly efficient, flexible and portable. It implements machine
learning algorithms under the Gradient Boosting framework. XGBoost
provides a parallel tree boosting (also known as GBDT, GBM) that solve
many data science problems in a fast and accurate way. The same code
runs on major distributed environment (Hadoop, SGE, MPI) and can solve
problems beyond billions of examples.
dependent_to.name: xgboost

dependent_to.description:
Xolotl is a high-performance computing code using advection-reaction-
diffusion (ADR) kinetic rate theory to model the time evolution of the
divertor material in next generation tokamaks, like ITER, as well as
nuclear fuel in fission reactors.
dependent_to.name: xolotl

dependent_to.description:
XSBench is a mini-app representing a key computational kernel of the
Monte Carlo neutronics application OpenMC. A full explanation of the
theory and purpose of XSBench is provided in docs/XSBench_Theory.pdf.
dependent_to.name: xsbench

dependent_to.description:
Xsdk is a suite of Department of Energy (DOE) packages for numerical
simulation. This is a Spack bundle package that installs the xSDK
packages
dependent_to.name: xsdk

dependent_to.description: xSDK Examples show usage of libraries in the xSDK package.
dependent_to.name: xsdk-examples

dependent_to.description:
Yaksa is a high-performance datatype engine for expressing, managing and
manipulating data present in noncontiguous memory regions. It provides
portable abstractions for structured noncontiguous data layouts that are
much more comprehensive compared with traditional I/O vectors. Yaksa
imitates parts of the MPI Datatype system, but adds additional
functionality that would allow it to be used independent of MPI. It
provides routines for packing/unpacking, creating I/O vectors (array of
contiguous segments) and flattening/unflattening datatypes into process-
portable formats. Yaksa's backend includes support for CPUs as well as
different GPUs.
dependent_to.name: yaksa

dependent_to.description:
Utility for monitoring process, thread, OS and HW resources, including
GPU utilization.
dependent_to.name: zerosum

dependent_to.description:
zfp is a compressed number format for multidimensional floating-point
and integer arrays. zfp provides compressed-array classes that support
high throughput read and write random access to individual array
elements. zfp also supports serial and parallel (OpenMP and CUDA)
compression of whole arrays.
dependent_to.name: zfp

description:
CUDA is a parallel computing platform and programming model invented by
NVIDIA. It enables dramatic increases in computing performance by
harnessing the power of the graphics processing unit (GPU). Note: This
package does not currently install the drivers necessary to run CUDA.
These will need to be installed manually. See:
https://docs.nvidia.com/cuda/ for details.
name: cuda

variants.description: Allow unsupported host compiler and CUDA version combinations
variants.name: allow-unsupported-compilers

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system

variants.description: Enable development dependencies, i.e to use cuda-gdb
variants.name: dev
